definition: dog-eat-dog/dogfight
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
to bite/to nip
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]

sentences.english: The question is a comparison between himself and Lee Myung-bak.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題是在將他自己與李螟勃進行了狗咬狗地比較。

sentences.english: This is an imperialist dog-eat-dog type of war.
sentences.chinese: 這是一場“帝國主義狗咬狗的戰爭”。

sentences.english: Must we let this become one of those places?
sentences.chinese: 難道我們就不能遠離那些狗咬狗式的口角戰爭嗎？

sentences.english: So how does all of this dog-eat-dog consolidation affect you?
sentences.chinese: 因此狗咬狗的模式是如何影響你的呢？

sentences.english: It'a another case of dog eat dog .
sentences.chinese: 這又是一宗狗咬狗的事件。

sentences.english: Some people say we live in adogeatdogdog-eat-dog world.
sentences.chinese: 一些人說我們活在狗咬狗的世界。

definition: see 窩裡鬥|窝里斗[wo1 li5 dou4]
internal strife (family, group, etc)
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
(of a villain) to do the dirty on another villain
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
lit. sandpiper and clam war together and the fisherman catches both (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
pinyin: yu4 bang4 xiang1 zheng1 , yu2 weng1 de2 li4

definition: both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
variant of 內訌|内讧[nei4 hong4]
jackals of the same tribe (idiom); fig. They are all just as bad as each other.
to start a feud/to become enemies
